hackathon-description-text: For the first time in the UK, two King's College London societies team up to provide an Inter-University hackathon open to undergraduates across the country. Are you ready to trade your sleep and create something awesome?
hackathon-eligibility:
Anyone registered to HackKing's can enter
Team Sizes: Max 4 people
Projects must be completed during HackKing's
hackathon-rules:
- YOU MUST BE AT HackKing's TO WORK ON A PROJECT FOR SUBMISSION
- We strongly discourage building off of existing projects you've worked on. To be fair to others, let us know if you are using some of your old code in your hacks. Using third-party APIs and libraries is definitely okay, as long as they're accessible by everyone else as well.
- You cannot steal another team's source code
- The decision of judges is final for determining prizes and awards
- Please comply with all instructions from HackKing's organizers

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The top three ideas will get a chance to pitch their ideas to investors, and the best of those will receive a £15,000 investment! Steer is also going to be offering free mentoring for all three teams!
Get your team selected for Skype interviews with Codecademy. You can't put a price on this one.
Everyone on the team gets a brand new Pebble!

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best use of JUST EAT API

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Get an office space in Central London to continue working on your idea! Sponsored by Onfider.
The best use of SendGrid's API get a wireless bluetooth speaker for each team member!
TreeHouse Gold subscriptions and LiveCode subscriptions.
TreeHouse Silver subscriptions for everyone in the team.
Use of Novoda's open source API's get 0.5 BTC for the team!

hackathon-description-header: The UK's Largest, Student-Run, University Hackathon
